snippet: The NY Phil Biennial presented two compositions dedicated to manual labor on Friday at Avery Fisher Hall: Julia Wolfe’s “Anthracite Fields” and Steven Mackey’s “Dreamhouse.”
abstract: Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim reviews premieres of Julia Wolfe piece Anthracite Fields, performed by Bang on a Can All-Stars and Choir of Trinity Wall Street, and Steven Mackey piece Dreamhouse, performed by New York Philharmonic with accompanying singers, at Avery Fisher Hall as part of NY Phil Biennial festival.
lead_paragraph: The NY Phil Biennial presented two compositions dedicated to manual labor on Friday at Avery Fisher Hall: Julia Wolfe’s “Anthracite Fields” and Steven Mackey’s “Dreamhouse.”

headline.seo: NY Phil Biennial Offers Themes of Mining and Building
headline.main: For Ensembles and Singers, a Night of Backbreaking Labor
headline.print_headline: For Ensembles and Singers, a Night of Backbreaking Labor
